title: Contact Sensor documentation not updated after PR for link related changes

content.raw:
As per the discussion in the issue #545 and the pull request  in (#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/355/bullet-contact-sensor/diff), it can be observed that the forces and torques are applied at the CG of perspective links for each collision body, specified in the link origin frame. 

However, the documentation remains un-updated.    According to the documentation in  (http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1sensors_1_1ContactSensor.html#a5e8c0561a71708862c4304d6174512e9l ), the forces and torques are applied at the CG of perspective links for each collision body, specified in the inertial frame. This is very misleading until one can go through the issues and pull requests made for the corresponding changes.

Also, the distinction between the inertial frame (frame at the CG of the link) and the inertial frame(world frame) cannot be clearly inferred in this case. This could lead the user of the API to wrongly assume the frames. It would be great if something could be done regarding this.

Thanks!

@traversaro
